body_html: Why do the genrule targets need to be commented out? Shouldn't it be sufficient to just mark the tests manual as was done before? If that's not sufficient, adding tags = [ "local", "manual", ], will definitely have Jenkins skip them for now until a fix is ready. As is, this breaks TensorFlow Serving and we can't sync to head. Can we revert this change or uncomment the genrules?
body_text: Why do the genrule targets need to be commented out? Shouldn't it be sufficient to just mark the tests manual as was done before? If that's not sufficient, adding tags = [ "local", "manual", ], will definitely have Jenkins skip them for now until a fix is ready. As is, this breaks TensorFlow Serving and we can't sync to head. Can we revert this change or uncomment the genrules?
body:
Why do the genrule targets need to be commented out? Shouldn't it be sufficient to just mark the tests manual as was done before? If that's not sufficient, adding `tags = [
        "local",
        "manual",
    ],` will definitely have Jenkins skip them for now until a fix is ready. As is, this breaks TensorFlow Serving and we can't sync to head. Can we revert this change or uncomment the genrules?
